Thanks to all of our parents/guardians who have been patient during the first few days of school!

Today, we highlight Automotive Refinishing and Collision instructor Mike Maloney, who was selected as Teacher of the Year at the Elkhart Area Career Center.

Mike has been a teacher at the Elkhart Area Career Center for 27 years.

Mike was born and raised in Elkhart County. He is a third generation collision repair/refinish technician, ASE-certified since 1985. Today is another special day in the school world: National School Principal's Day! Our principals can be found every day greeting students as they arrive at school, truly excited to see every child enter their buildings. For leading our schools, building strong relationships, and always striving to improve the lives of their students, thank you to all our incredible principals!

Yesterday, the Elkhart County Soil and Water Conservation District hosted the 78th Annual Elkhart County Conservation Award Ceremony. The award ceremony recognizes farmers, educators and business leaders for their efforts in protecting the environment.

The Conservation Educator of the Year award was presented to Elkhart Community Schools' ACCELL Farm (Agriculture Community Center for Environmental Learning Lab). The ACCELL farm is used by hundreds of ECS students every year to take advantage of hands-on learning in outdoor labs and classrooms where students can learn about various agriculture-related subjects including; plants, animals, and water conservation.

We would also like to recognize three students from Pinewood Elementary School who were recognized for their posters at the event.

1st Place: Kathelyn Bravo
2nd Place: Nathan Windy
3rd Place: Jack Graham

Thank you! #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay

Our hearts and thoughts are with the friends and family of Austin Charters, a student in the School Without Walls program, who passed away over the weekend.

Austin approached life with passion, whether it was academics, friendships, or athletics. He was smart, artistic, and always honest. Austin's fire-red hair was a true match for his personality - fiery, but warm. He was well-liked by students and staff, and deep down had an incredible gentleness. Austin had a strong personality, an amazing smile, and loved to play basketball. Everyone who knew Austin truly felt his passion for life.

Austin will be deeply missed by all who knew him. Our hearts are with Austin's family and friends, as well as the Elkhart Memorial, Elkhart Central, Pierre Moran, and Bristol school communities.
